info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 22 at 4:51PM MST until July 22 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
FFWTWC
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Central Cochise County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 645 PM MST.
* At 451 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing between 0.75 and 1.50 inches of heavy rain across central Cochise county, especially along and west of Highway 191 near Courtland Road to the north of Elfrida. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly, especially along the drainages west of Highway 191 that drain into Whitewater Draw.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sunizona.
This includes the following highways... Route 181 near mile marker 39...and near mile marker 41. Route 191 between mile markers 25 and 38.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 6:45 PM MST. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 6:45 PM MST. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 6:45 PM MST. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 6:45 PM MST. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
